Diagnosis
	1. Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor (insulinoma) of pancreatic tail

	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Laparoscopic distal pancreatectomy with spleen preservation

	Radiotherapy
	Not indicated

	Chemotherapy
	Not indicated

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	No evidence of disease

	Current issues
	Mild post-operative diabetes

	Summary of consultation
	I reviewed [redacted name] today for her three-month post-operative assessment. She has made an excellent recovery following her laparoscopic distal pancreatectomy for insulinoma. Her pre-operative symptoms of hypoglycemia have completely resolved. She no longer experiences episodes of confusion, sweating or palpitations. Her blood glucose levels have stabilized, though she requires small doses of metformin to manage mild post-operative diabetes.?

Her surgical wounds have healed well with no complications. She has regained her previous energy levels and has returned to work as a primary school teacher. Her appetite is good and her weight has remained stable at 68kg.?

Blood tests today show normal fasting insulin at 8 mIU/L (previously 45 mIU/L) and normal C-peptide levels. Chromogranin A is within normal range.?

	Further investigations
	Routine surveillance MRI pancreas in 6 months

	Medication prescribed
	Metformin 500mg twice daily

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up will be in 6 months with repeat MRI
Next surgical follow up with Mr [redacted name] in 3 months

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor blood glucose levels and HbA1c
Please adjust metformin dose as needed based on blood glucose readings

	Summary of information given to the patient about their cancer and future progress
	Discussed excellent prognosis following complete surgical resection. Explained surveillance plan with 6-monthly MRI scans for first two years, then annual scanning. Patient understands to report any return of hypoglycemic symptoms.
